revised_title: The Use of Sea-Sand and Lime for Fertilizing Land in Devonshire
tldr: Dr. Arthur Bury explains the use of sea-sand and lime as fertilizers in Devonshire. Sea-salt and lime, when mixed together, improve soil fertility and produce rich pastures for grazing sheep year-round. Bury suggests that every gentleman should learn this method to enrich their country and themselves. Glauber's method of creating a compost mix using quicklime, salt, and water is also discussed.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil Science
